page.title: 10TOURISM CLAPHAM
page.content: Clapham is a good place for tourists and hikers,because it is a limestone area and has caves,rivers,and woodland trails.Tourists come all the year round, and the busiest time is between May and September. One of the most popular trails is the Reginald Farrer trail.Reginald Farrer was born at the top of the village in Ingleborough Hall.He was born in 1880 and died 1920.He died of diptheria in Burma.He went round the world collecting shrubs and especially alpines.Later a trail was made to show the public nature's wonders around Clapham. Along the Nature Trail the trees start in a bundle making the ground have a roof.When we get to the Cave it opens out.The path is made of soil and stones,but it is smooth apart from roots.There are some natural trees
